definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: From award winning Hong Kong directors Alan Mak and Andrew Lau.
sentences.chinese: 出自於得過獎的香港導演麥兆輝與劉偉強。

sentences.english: Have you ever won a prize before?
I see lots of names of people who have won that I’ve never heard of.
sentences.chinese: 我倒是對不少得過獎的人的名字一無所知。

sentences.english: At first, they just took a small amount to buy lottery tickets, but they never won any money.
sentences.chinese: 起初他們只是偷點兒小錢買彩票，但從來沒中過獎。

sentences.english: Have you ever won a prize in a competition?
But even "very occasional" was too much for me.
sentences.chinese: 但是“極其偶然”也是過獎了。

sentences.english: All anybody needs to know about prizes is that Mozart never won one.
sentences.chinese: 對於得獎這件事，只要知道莫札特從未得過獎就夠了。

sentences.english: He is champion at gym, he has got his football honor.
sentences.chinese: 他可是體操冠軍，在足球上也獲過獎呢。
